flower_fairy: Oh! I didn’t see you there—your footsteps are so soft!
Careful now… the petals bruise easily.
You smell like sunshine today. Have you been somewhere warm?
Wait—don’t move. A wish is clinging to your sleeve.
Every flower here hums when you're near. Isn’t that lovely?
Can you feel it? The air is brighter when someone kind arrives.
Oh! A visitor! I hope you brought gentle intentions.
Please tread softly. The little sprouts are listening.
Some things bloom only when noticed. Thank you for looking.
The forest told me you'd come. It speaks in shivers and leaf-songs.
If you ever feel lost, sit by a flower. We always know the way.
Your heart feels warm. Flowers love hearts like that.
Are you chasing beauty, or is it chasing you?
I’ve been weaving sunlight all morning—do you like it?
The world grows quiet when someone kind walks by.
You carry a soft glow… did you pick up stray magic again?
I could teach you to speak to flowers, if you whisper first.
Please… protect the gentle things. Not everything can defend itself.
Some petals fall, but not all disappear. Remember that.
Stay a moment—beauty rushes for no one.
thorn_fairy: Watch it! I’m pointy for a reason.
Oh look, another wanderer who thinks they won’t get poked.
If you step on my thorns, that’s on you.
Don’t get too close. I bite. Metaphorically. Usually.
What do you want? Make it quick.
You lost, or just bad at walking in straight lines?
Please tell me you’re not here to pick something. I hate pickers.
If you cry easily, maybe don’t talk to me.
Trust me—flowers are overrated. Try being sharp for once.
I don’t do hugs. Ever. Don’t even ask.
You’ve got that ‘I’m about to do something foolish’ look.
If trouble follows you, keep it away from me.
Touch a thorn, get a lesson. Simple.
I can smell fear. Or maybe that’s just you.
What? Staring is rude. Stop that.
I’m not mean. I’m efficient.
Flattery won’t work on me. Bribes might.
Go on, step closer. See what happens.
If you're looking for wisdom, try someone softer.
Fine. You may speak. Briefly.
luna_fairy: The moon tilted slightly when you arrived. It noticed you.
Your shadow hums… curious.
Do you dream often? I can see traces of them on your sleeves.
The stars whisper when you pass. They say interesting things.
Time ripples around you—has it always done that?
There is something hidden in your path, but it’s patient.
Sit still. The night wants to measure you.
Your presence shifts the constellations by one breath.
Some travelers carry silence. You carry echoes.
I once saw a future with your silhouette in it.
Don’t be alarmed if the moonlight bends around you.
Dreams cling to you like frost. Beautiful.
Do you hear that? The quiet between thoughts? That’s where I live.
Something follows you—not dangerous, just curious.
You are woven with stardust more tightly than most.
The night sky opened a little wider when you walked in.
You feel out of place… in a way the universe enjoys.
Careful what you wish under moonlight. It listens too well.
Every choice you make nudges a constellation.
You glow softly, like a secret waiting to be told.
